When editing some lines in VSCode in a file I donâ€™t know very well, I am often a bit lost about which sections, namespaces and variables are currently ins cope., for example to understand what the full name of a def foo at this point will be.
Is there a command to give me that command, or a way to see it in the info view?
Unfortunately it causes a recompile of the file. I think in Lean 4 you can obtain this info without disrupting the file.
Yeah, in Lean 4 it's shown as path segments at the top of the editor window. I don't think there's an explicit command for it.
Joachim Breitner has marked this topic as resolved.
@Chris B Can you also see which variables are currently in scope?

@Johan Commelin

Not right now. If you click on the namespace/section it will expand to show you the declarations therein, but not variables. Including the variables seems like a reasonable feature request for the extension though.
